document.masterDocTitle: Primulina dongguanica F. Wen, Y. G. Wei & R. Q. Luo (Gesneriaceae), a new species from South China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Primulina dongguanica F. Wen, Y. G. Wei & R. Q. Luo (Gesneriaceae), a new species from South China

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Guangxi Key Laboratory of Functional Phytochemicals Research, Guilin Botanic Garden, Guangxi / Institute of Botany, Yanshan District, Guilin, CN- 541006, Guangxi, China.

subSubSection.paragraph: Differences between the new species and its morphologically related species are shown in the following identification key:

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Bracts large, positioned at a ca. 180-degree angle for the inflorescence.................................................................. 2

2. Bracts ovate to orbicular-ovate, ca. 45 X ca. 28 mm , margin entire ..................................................
P.eburnea

2a. Bracts ovate to lanceolate, 10-40 X 4-16 mm , margin entire or crenulate to serrulate.......................................
P.dryas
3. Calyx lobes, lanceolate-linear, corolla outer side densely puberulent and glandular puberulent............................. 4

3a. Calyx lobes broadly lanceolate, corolla outer side densely erect-pubescent.......................................
P.dongguanica

caption.paragraph: Fig. 5. – Primulina dryas (Dunn) Mich. Möller &. Weber and P. napoensis (Z. Y. Li) Mich. Möller &. Weber. A-D: P. dryas . A. Habit; B. Cyme; C. Frontal view of flower and stigma; D. Capsule. E-H: P. napoensis . E. Habit; F. Cyme; G. Frontal view of flower; H. Stigma.

subSubSection.paragraph: [Photos: A-B, D-H: Fang Wen; C: Peter Man]
[Photos: Jian Li, Fang Wen and Xin Hong]

caption.paragraph: Table 1. – Main differences between Primulina dongguanica F. Wen, Y. G. Wei & R. Q. Luo and the morphologically similar species, P. eburnea (Hance) Y. Z. Wang , P. dryas (Dunn) Mich. Möller & A. Weber , P. napoensis (Z. Y. Li) Mich. Möller &. Weber and P. spec. nov.

tr.th: Bracts rhombic, 21-25 X 12-16 mm, positioned at a ca.45° angle when flowering, pubescent outside, nearly glabrous inside, margin entire
tr.td: ovate to orbicular-ovate, ca.45 X ca. 28 mm, ovate to lanceolate,10-40 X 4-16 mm, densely puberulent outside, pubescent to villous,margin entire or positioned at a ca.180° angle when crenulate to serrulate, apex acute, flowering,margin entire positioned at a ca.180° angle or reflexed when flowering, generally withered in florescence
narrowly oblong,15-35 X ca.3 mm, positioned at from ca.120° angle to reflexed when flowering, puberulent outside,margin entire
ovate to orbicular-ovate,15-20 X 8-12 mm, positioned at a ca.120° angle when flowering, densely puberulent outside,glabrous inside,margin entire
outer side densely erect-pubescent, inner glabrous
outer side sparsely pubescent to pilose, inner puberulent only on purple spot of adaxial lip
outside puberulent and glandular puberulent,inside glabrous
outer side densely puberulent and glandular puberulent,inner glabrous, but adaxial lobes base sparsely puberulent

tr.th: Size of corolla lip [mm] adaxial lip: ca.10; abaxial lip:12-13
tr.td: adaxial lip: ca.2; abaxial lip: ca. 5.5
adaxial lip: 8-10; abaxial lip: ca.11 mm
2.2-3 cm long,densely puberulent and glandular puberulent
1.8-2.5 cm long,puberulent to pilose and glandular pubescent
2.2-2.5 cm long,densely puberulent and glandular puberulent
